{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Officer",
  "description": "At Uwana Energy, we upgrade how you live and work by ensuring you don&#39;t have to think about light or generator issues again! Whether it&#39;s for your comfort at home, productive use, or commercial / industrial purposes, we have a solar system for you. As an indigenous company, we experienced the power challenges and frustrations you go through and we have created a simple path to a better life.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Marketing Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full-time, Hybrid
Level: Mid Level

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced&nbsp;Marketing Officer to drive business growth through strategic marketing initiatives.
	This role involves overseeing the development and execution of growth strategies across digital and traditional channels to expand our user base and revenue streams.
	The ideal candidate will also have expertise in search engine marketing, analytics, SEO, and PR while also executing hands-on digital campaigns, content creation, and lead nurturing to enhance Uwana Energy&rsquo;s visibility and customer acquisition.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Marketing &amp; Business Growth:


	Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, customer engagement, and revenue growth.
	Define product positioning, value propositions, and messaging that resonate with our target audience.
	Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify growth opportunities and emerging trends.
	Leverage data-driven insights to optimise marketing campaigns and improve ROI.
	Plan and execute PR campaigns, build media relationships, and manage public relations efforts.
	Manage SEO and SEM campaigns to enhance online presence and organic search rankings.
	Develop and monitor marketing budgets, ensuring cost-effective strategies.


Digital Marketing &amp; Content Execution:


	Lead the creation of engaging marketing content, including blogs, social media posts, email campaigns, and promotional materials.
	Optimise digital marketing channels, including social media, partnerships, and webinars.
	Track and analyse performance metrics (e.g., conversion rates, and customer acquisition costs) to refine marketing efforts.
	Collaborate with creative teams to enhance branding, messaging, and campaign effectiveness.
	Oversee website performance optimisation, including landing page improvements and user experience enhancements.
	Manage outbound and inbound marketing strategies to drive lead generation and customer acquisition.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in product marketing, digital marketing, or a similar role, preferably in a startup or tech environment.
	Strong understanding of product lifecycle, market research, and competitive analysis.
	Excellent communication, storytelling, and content creation skills.
	Proficiency in Google Ads, Google Analytics, and SEO tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz).
	Ability to think strategically and execute tactically.
	Self-starter with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
	Experience working with cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously.


Benefits


	Remote-first
	Health insurance (HMO)
	Pension plan
	Opportunities for career progression
	A supportive, inclusive work environment that values innovation.
	Team-building activities
	End-of-month team lunch at the office
	Discounts on company products and other perks.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;HR@uwanaenergy.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Uwana Energy is an equal-opportunity employer.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-09",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-10",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Uwana Energy"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

Marketing Officer Job at Uwana Energy




        
    

        
        At Uwana Energy, we upgrade how you live and work by ensuring you don't have to think about light or generator issues again! Whether it's for your comfort at home, productive use, or commercial / industrial purposes, we have a solar system for you. As an indigenous company, we experienced the power challenges and frustrations you go through and we have created a simple path to a better life.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time, Hybrid
Level: Mid Level

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced Marketing Officer to drive business growth through strategic marketing initiatives.
	This role involves overseeing the development and execution of growth strategies across digital and traditional channels to expand our user base and revenue streams.
	The ideal candidate will also have expertise in search engine marketing, analytics, SEO, and PR while also executing hands-on digital campaigns, content creation, and lead nurturing to enhance Uwana Energy’s visibility and customer acquisition.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Marketing & Business Growth:


	Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, customer engagement, and revenue growth.
	Define product positioning, value propositions, and messaging that resonate with our target audience.
	Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify growth opportunities and emerging trends.
	Leverage data-driven insights to optimise marketing campaigns and improve ROI.
	Plan and execute PR campaigns, build media relationships, and manage public relations efforts.
	Manage SEO and SEM campaigns to enhance online presence and organic search rankings.
	Develop and monitor marketing budgets, ensuring cost-effective strategies.


Digital Marketing & Content Execution:


	Lead the creation of engaging marketing content, including blogs, social media posts, email campaigns, and promotional materials.
	Optimise digital marketing channels, including social media, partnerships, and webinars.
	Track and analyse performance metrics (e.g., conversion rates, and customer acquisition costs) to refine marketing efforts.
	Collaborate with creative teams to enhance branding, messaging, and campaign effectiveness.
	Oversee website performance optimisation, including landing page improvements and user experience enhancements.
	Manage outbound and inbound marketing strategies to drive lead generation and customer acquisition.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in product marketing, digital marketing, or a similar role, preferably in a startup or tech environment.
	Strong understanding of product lifecycle, market research, and competitive analysis.
	Excellent communication, storytelling, and content creation skills.
	Proficiency in Google Ads, Google Analytics, and SEO tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz).
	Ability to think strategically and execute tactically.
	Self-starter with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
	Experience working with cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously.


Benefits


	Remote-first
	Health insurance (HMO)
	Pension plan
	Opportunities for career progression
	A supportive, inclusive work environment that values innovation.
	Team-building activities
	End-of-month team lunch at the office
	Discounts on company products and other perks.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: HR@uwanaenergy.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Uwana Energy is an equal-opportunity employer.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Female Hotel Receptionist Job at Extramileage Consults Limited




        
    

        
        Extramileage Consults Limited - Our client, a Luxurious Hotel, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Hotel Receptionist

Job Location: Ojodu- Berger, Lagos

Requirements


	Must be professional, good-looking, & possess a perfect command of English
	Computer literacy is compulsory
	Minimum of National Diploma.


Remuneration
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Salary: N70,000 Monthly.
	Staff Lunch
	Monthly Service Charge
	1 Day in, 1 Day Out

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: extramileageconsultslimited@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 08037910516.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Office Assistant",
  "description": "BFREE - We are a young, innovative and Nigeria&rsquo;s foremost ethical debt collection startup. If you want to have fun while working in a fun environment, earn very well when you perform like a rock-star, and be part of a company where your voice matters, then Bfree is the place for you. Because we hate status-quo and we hate mediocre - we founded BFREE to revolutionize debt recovery in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Position Overview


	We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Office Assistant to join our team.
	This role is essential to maintaining a clean, organized, and professional work environment.
	The ideal candidate will take initiative, possess hands-on cleaning experience, have basic computer literacy, and demonstrate strong attention to detail.
	You will be responsible for daily cleaning, restocking supplies, and supporting the smooth day-to-day operations of the office.


Key Responsibilities


	Take full ownership of maintaining cleanliness across all office areas, including workstations, common areas, restrooms, and glass partitions. Disinfect high-touch surfaces regularly and ensure floors, desks, and office furniture are clean and presentable.
	Monitor and promptly restock essential supplies in restrooms, kitchen, and workstations, also keep a detailed checklist and cleaning log, using basic computer skills to track tasks and supplies.
	Use initiative to identify areas needing attention and suggest improvements to maintain hygiene and orderliness.
	Assist with inventory control and coordinate restocking of cleaning materials and tools.
	Any other duties as assigned by your supervisor.


Qualifications and Skills


	High School Diploma (SSCE) or equivalent required.
	Proven experience in janitorial, custodial, or office cleaning roles.
	Strong sense of initiative and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
	Good communication skills and ability to follow both verbal and written instructions.
	Knowledge of cleaning products, equipment, and techniques.
	Attention to detail and thoroughness in cleaning tasks.
	Basic computer skills (e.g., updating logs, and using email).
	Flexibility to adapt to changing cleaning needs and schedules.
	Basic maintenance skills are an advantage.
	Candidates must stay or live around Berger, Ikeja, Ketu, Magodo, Ojota, and Ogudu axis of Lagos State.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;people@bfree.africa&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Office Assistant Job at BFREE




        
    

        
        BFREE - We are a young, innovative and Nigeria’s foremost ethical debt collection startup. If you want to have fun while working in a fun environment, earn very well when you perform like a rock-star, and be part of a company where your voice matters, then Bfree is the place for you. Because we hate status-quo and we hate mediocre - we founded BFREE to revolutionize debt recovery in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Position Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Office Assistant to join our team.
	This role is essential to maintaining a clean, organized, and professional work environment.
	The ideal candidate will take initiative, possess hands-on cleaning experience, have basic computer literacy, and demonstrate strong attention to detail.
	You will be responsible for daily cleaning, restocking supplies, and supporting the smooth day-to-day operations of the office.


Key Responsibilities


	Take full ownership of maintaining cleanliness across all office areas, including workstations, common areas, restrooms, and glass partitions. Disinfect high-touch surfaces regularly and ensure floors, desks, and office furniture are clean and presentable.
	Monitor and promptly restock essential supplies in restrooms, kitchen, and workstations, also keep a detailed checklist and cleaning log, using basic computer skills to track tasks and supplies.
	Use initiative to identify areas needing attention and suggest improvements to maintain hygiene and orderliness.
	Assist with inventory control and coordinate restocking of cleaning materials and tools.
	Any other duties as assigned by your supervisor.


Qualifications and Skills


	High School Diploma (SSCE) or equivalent required.
	Proven experience in janitorial, custodial, or office cleaning roles.
	Strong sense of initiative and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
	Good communication skills and ability to follow both verbal and written instructions.
	Knowledge of cleaning products, equipment, and techniques.
	Attention to detail and thoroughness in cleaning tasks.
	Basic computer skills (e.g., updating logs, and using email).
	Flexibility to adapt to changing cleaning needs and schedules.
	Basic maintenance skills are an advantage.
	Candidates must stay or live around Berger, Ikeja, Ketu, Magodo, Ojota, and Ogudu axis of Lagos State.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: people@bfree.africa using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Development Representative",
  "description": "Punch is a full-service digital agency. We are designers, engineers, and marketers on a mission to build the best digital experiences.

We champion a boutique approach to product development. We have small teams, the best talent, and a horizontal management structure. The goal is to create a natural partner for your organization. Projects are handled between our three offices in San Francisco, New York, and Lahore, Pakistan. Each project uses all our resources and talents in-house.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Sales Development Representative&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos

What we look for


	We value the ability to adapt to change and a desire for professional growth.
	We work hard to provide our talent opportunities to grow their skills through meaningful work.
	We are looking for a Sales Development Representative to join our team.


Responsibilities


	Prospect, educate &amp; qualify leads to create sales-ready opportunities
	Master the ability to evangelise the Punch story
	Align Punch solutions with the prospect&#39;s business objectives &amp; needs
	Collaborate with sales reps to schedule prospect calls, meetings and demos
	Proactively keep abreast of our industry and the technology landscape to ensure you are a trusted resource to prospects and customers
	Make strategic outbound calls &amp; emails daily
	Acquire key prospect data from the initial conversation, from the web and other sources, and ensure clean and accurate data is entered and maintained in CRM
	Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of qualified appointments/demos scheduled and deals closed


Requirements


	Speak English fluently with a neutral accent
	6 months or 1 year of B2B technical sales experience (or other qualified sales experience)
	Bachelor&#39;s degree preferred in Business or related field
	Proven success in prospecting new markets and setting appointments with new business.

Sales Development Representative  Job at Punch




        
    

        
        Punch is a full-service digital agency. We are designers, engineers, and marketers on a mission to build the best digital experiences.

We champion a boutique approach to product development. We have small teams, the best talent, and a horizontal management structure. The goal is to create a natural partner for your organization. Projects are handled between our three offices in San Francisco, New York, and Lahore, Pakistan. Each project uses all our resources and talents in-house.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Development Representative 

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

What we look for
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We value the ability to adapt to change and a desire for professional growth.
	We work hard to provide our talent opportunities to grow their skills through meaningful work.
	We are looking for a Sales Development Representative to join our team.


Responsibilities


	Prospect, educate & qualify leads to create sales-ready opportunities
	Master the ability to evangelise the Punch story
	Align Punch solutions with the prospect's business objectives & needs
	Collaborate with sales reps to schedule prospect calls, meetings and demos
	Proactively keep abreast of our industry and the technology landscape to ensure you are a trusted resource to prospects and customers
	Make strategic outbound calls & emails daily
	Acquire key prospect data from the initial conversation, from the web and other sources, and ensure clean and accurate data is entered and maintained in CRM
	Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of qualified appointments/demos scheduled and deals closed


Requirements


	Speak English fluently with a neutral accent
	6 months or 1 year of B2B technical sales experience (or other qualified sales experience)
	Bachelor's degree preferred in Business or related field
	Proven success in prospecting new markets and setting appointments with new business.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Software Quality Assurance Engineer",
  "description": "Punch is a full-service digital agency. We are designers, engineers, and marketers on a mission to build the best digital experiences.

We champion a boutique approach to product development. We have small teams, the best talent, and a horizontal management structure. The goal is to create a natural partner for your organization.

Projects are handled between our three offices in San Francisco, New York, and Lahore, Pakistan. Each project uses all our resources and talents in-house.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Software Quality Assurance Engineer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos

What We Look For


	We value the ability to adapt to change and a desire for professional growth.
	We work hard to provide our talent opportunities to grow their skills through meaningful work.


Job Responsibilities


	Develop and execute comprehensive test cases and test plans for web and mobile applications.
	Perform manual testing and contribute to automation testing where applicable.
	Identify, log, and track bugs; verify fixes and ensure product quality.
	Collaborate with developers, designers, and product managers to resolve issues quickly.
	Conduct functional, regression, smoke, and exploratory testing.
	Maintain clear QA documentation and testing reports.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	1 - 2 years of professional experience in software QA/testing.
	Strong understanding of QA methodologies, SDLC, and Agile processes.
	Hands-on experience with bug-tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello, or similar).
	Familiarity with automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright) is a plus.
	Basic knowledge of API testing (Postman or similar).
	Detail-oriented with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits at Punch


	Competitive Salary &amp; Performance Bonuses
	Paid Time Off &amp; Holidays
	Health &amp; Wellness Support
	Professional Growth &amp; Development
	Collaborative Culture &amp; Recognition
	Operational Support &amp; Relocation Assistance.


Note


	Punch is an equal opportunity employer.
	We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, race, religion, age, or background.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-10",

  },

Software Quality Assurance Engineer  Job at Punch




        
    

        
        Punch is a full-service digital agency. We are designers, engineers, and marketers on a mission to build the best digital experiences.

We champion a boutique approach to product development. We have small teams, the best talent, and a horizontal management structure. The goal is to create a natural partner for your organization.

Projects are handled between our three offices in San Francisco, New York, and Lahore, Pakistan. Each project uses all our resources and talents in-house.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Quality Assurance Engineer 

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

What We Look For
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We value the ability to adapt to change and a desire for professional growth.
	We work hard to provide our talent opportunities to grow their skills through meaningful work.


Job Responsibilities


	Develop and execute comprehensive test cases and test plans for web and mobile applications.
	Perform manual testing and contribute to automation testing where applicable.
	Identify, log, and track bugs; verify fixes and ensure product quality.
	Collaborate with developers, designers, and product managers to resolve issues quickly.
	Conduct functional, regression, smoke, and exploratory testing.
	Maintain clear QA documentation and testing reports.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	1 - 2 years of professional experience in software QA/testing.
	Strong understanding of QA methodologies, SDLC, and Agile processes.
	Hands-on experience with bug-tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello, or similar).
	Familiarity with automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright) is a plus.
	Basic knowledge of API testing (Postman or similar).
	Detail-oriented with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits at Punch


	Competitive Salary & Performance Bonuses
	Paid Time Off & Holidays
	Health & Wellness Support
	Professional Growth & Development
	Collaborative Culture & Recognition
	Operational Support & Relocation Assistance.


Note


	Punch is an equal opportunity employer.
	We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, race, religion, age, or background.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
